Bos McDonald's Dipecat karena Hubungan Gelap dengan Anak Buah
04 Nov 2019, 04:39 by Ignacio Geordi Oswaldo


Foto: Istimewa

Jakarta - Perusahaan waralaba restoran cepat saji McDonald's memecat Steve Easterbrook dari posisinya sebagai CEO. Steve dipecat dari posisinya pada Minggu (3/11/2019) karena melanggar kebijakan perusahaan dengan menjalin hubungan asmara dengan anak buah. Namun pihak McDonald tidak memberikan detail lain tentang hubungan tersebut.Melansir dari CNBC, Senin (4/11/2019), Steve mengakui kesalahannya dan mengatakan kalau dia menerima keputusan perusahaan terkait pemecatannya."Ini adalah kesalahan," tulis Steve dalam email ke karyawan, dikutip dari CNBC, Senin (4/11)."Mengingat nilai-nilai perusahaan, saya setuju dengan dewan direksi bahwa inilah saatnya bagi saya untuk meninggalkan perusahaan," Jelasnya lagi.Perusahaan McDonald mengatakan dalam rilisnya bahwa dewan direksi perusahaan telah menentukan dan menunjuk CEO baru. Steve Easterbrook akan digantikan oleh Presiden McDonald's wilayah AS, Chris Kempczinski."Chris mengambil kendali perusahaan besar ini pada saat kinerja yang kuat dan berkelanjutan, dan Dewan memiliki keyakinan bahwa dia adalah pemimpin terbaik untuk menetapkan visi dan menggerakkan rencana untuk kesuksesan berkelanjutan perusahaan," kata Ketua Dewan Direksi McDonald's Enrique Hernandez Jr dalam sebuah pernyataan.Diangkat sebagai CEO baru, Chris mengatakan kalau dia merasa senang dan akan berkomitmen untuk mendorong nilai perusahaan bagi pemegang saham dan pemangku kepentingan lainnya."Saya senang bisa memimpin perusahaan yang luar biasa ini. Bekerja bersama tim kami yang berbakat, Dewan kami, pemegang waralaba dan pemasok kami, saya berkomitmen untuk menjunjung tinggi warisan kami yang kaya dalam melayani pelanggan kami dan mendorong nilai bagi pemegang saham kami dan pemangku kepentingan lainnya," Kata Chris dalam sebuah pernyataan. McDonald's Boss Fired for Dark Relations with Subordinates
Nov 04 2019, 04:39 by Ignacio Geordi Oswaldo


Photo: Special

Jakarta - McDonald's fast food restaurant franchise company fired Steve Easterbrook from his position as CEO. Steve was fired from his position on Sunday (3/11/2019) for violating company policy by having an affair with his men. But the McDonald did not provide other details about the relationship. Reporting from CNBC, Monday (11/04/2019), Steve admitted his mistake and said that he accepted the company's decision regarding his dismissal. "This is a mistake," Steve wrote in an email to employees, "Given the company's values, I agree with the board of directors that it is time for me to leave the company," he explained again. The company said in its release that the company's board of directors had determined and appointed the CEO new. Steve Easterbrook will be replaced by US McDonald's President, Chris Kempczinski. "Chris took control of this large company at a time of strong and sustained performance, and the Board has confidence that he is the best leader to set a vision and drive a plan for the company's continued success," said McDonald's Board of Directors Chairman Enrique Hernandez Jr. in a statement. Appointed as the new CEO, Chris said that he felt happy and would be committed to driving the value of the company for shareholders and other stakeholders. "I am delighted to be able to lead this extraordinary company. Working together "Our talented team, our Board, our franchisees and suppliers, I am committed to upholding our rich heritage in serving our customers and driving value for our shareholders and other stakeholders," Chris said in a statement.
